summary: Completed comprehensive testing of LedgerOS critical fixes iteration 3. All critical backend fixes verified working (100% success rate). Frontend testing confirms login with admin123, negative balance input, token persistence, and ledger detail functionality all working correctly. Found minor modal overlay issue but core functionality intact.

ui_bugs.issue: Modal overlays occasionally intercept pointer events preventing navigation clicks
ui_bugs.workaround: Press Escape key to close modals before navigation

console_errors.impact: Accessibility warning only, no functional impact

passed_tests: ✅ CRITICAL FIX 1: Login with password admin123 works (100% success)
✅ CRITICAL FIX 2: Create ledger with negative opening balance (-25000) works perfectly
✅ CRITICAL FIX 3: Token remains valid across page navigation (Dashboard, Transactions, Ledgers, Reports)
✅ CRITICAL FIX 4: Edit transaction API functionality working (backend verified)
✅ CRITICAL FIX 5: Ledger detail sheet shows transactions when clicked
Backend API authentication and all endpoints (100% success rate)
Negative balance input field accepts and stores negative values correctly
Frontend navigation between all pages without token expiration
Ledger creation with liability type and negative balances
Dashboard displays correct financial data including negative balances
No 'Invalid token' errors during normal application use
Session handling with axios interceptor working correctly
action_item_for_main_agent: Minor: Consider adding aria-describedby attributes to Dialog components for better accessibility. The modal overlay issue is minor and can be resolved by pressing Escape key.
